00053 /*! The maximum storage length for a probe set name in the CDF file. */
00054 #define MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH 64
00055 
00056 /*! The storage length for integrity md5 (hex) in the CDF file. */
00057 #define INTEGRITY_MD5_LENGTH 32

00061 /*! Storage for the header in a CDF file. */
00062 class CCDFFileHeader
00063 {
00064 protected:
00065     /*! The magic number in an XDA file */
00066     int m_Magic;
00067 
00068     /*! The version number */
00069     int m_Version;
00070 
00071         /*! The GUID */
00072         std::string m_GUID;
00073 
00074         /*! The integrity md5 */
00075         std::string m_IntegrityMd5;
00076 
00077         /*! The chip type - array type name without version (only apply to XDA version 4 or above */
00078         std::string m_ChipType;
00079 
00080         /*! The array of chip types - all array type names with and without versions (only apply to XDA version 4 or above */
00081         std::vector<std::string> m_ChipTypes;
00082 
00083     /*! The number of probe sets defined in the file */
00084     int m_NumProbeSets;
00085 
00086     /*! The number of QC probe sets in the file */
00087     int m_NumQCProbeSets;
00088 
00089     /*! The reference sequence (used for resequencing arrays only) */
00090     std::string m_Reference;
00091 
00092     /*! The number of feature columns in the array */
00093     unsigned short m_Cols;
00094 
00095     /*! The number of feature rows in the array */
00096     unsigned short m_Rows;
00097 
00098     /*! Friend to the parent class */
00099     friend class CCDFFileData;
00100 
00101 public:
00102         /*! Get CDF Format Version
00103          * @return CDF Format Version
00104          */
00105         int GetFormatVersion() const { return m_Version; }
00106 
00107         /*! Get GUID
00108          * @return GUID
00109          */
00110         std::string GetGUID() const { return m_GUID; }
00111 
00112         /*! Get integrity md5
00113          * @return The integrity md5
00114          */
00115         std::string GetIntegrityMd5() const { return m_IntegrityMd5; }
00116 
00117         /*! Get chip type - array type name without version
00118          * @return The chip type.
00119          */
00120         std::string GetChipType() const { return m_ChipType; }
00121 
00122         /*! Get chip types - array type names with and without version
00123          * @return The chip types.
00124          */
00125         std::vector<std::string> GetChipTypes() const { return m_ChipTypes; }
00126 
00127         /*! Gets the number of feature columns in the array.
00128      * @return The number of columns.
00129      */
00130     int GetCols() const { return m_Cols; }
00131 
00132     /*! Gets the number of feature rows in the array.
00133      * @return The number of rows.
00134      */
00135     int GetRows() const { return m_Rows; }
00136 
00137     /*! Gets the number of probe sets.
00138      * @return The number of probe sets.
00139      */
00140     int GetNumProbeSets() const { return m_NumProbeSets; }
00141 
00142     /*! Gets the number of QC probe sets.
00143      * @return The number of QC probe sets.
00144      */
00145     int GetNumQCProbeSets() const { return m_NumQCProbeSets; }
00146 
00147     /*! Gets the reference sequence (for resequencing arrays only).
00148      * @return The reference sequence.
00149      */
00150     std::string &GetReference() { return m_Reference; }
00151 
00152     /*! Constructor */
00153     CCDFFileHeader();
00154 };

00158 /*! Defines the type of probe sets stored in the CDF file */
00159 enum GeneChipProbeSetType
00160 {
00161     /*! Unknown probe set */
00162     UnknownProbeSetType,
00163 
00164     /*! Expression probe set */
00165     ExpressionProbeSetType,
00166 
00167     /*! Genotyping probe set */
00168     GenotypingProbeSetType,
00169 
00170     /*! Resequencing probe set */
00171     ResequencingProbeSetType,
00172 
00173     /*! Tag probe set */
00174     TagProbeSetType,
00175 
00176     /*! Copy number probe set. */
00177     CopyNumberProbeSetType,
00178 
00179     /*! Genotype control probe set. */
00180     GenotypeControlProbeSetType,
00181 
00182     /*! Expression control probe set. */
00183     ExpressionControlProbeSetType,
00184 
00185     /*! Polymorphic marker probe set. */
00186     MarkerProbeSetType,
00187 
00188     /*! Multichannel marker probe set. */
00189     MultichannelMarkerProbeSetType
00190 };
00191 
00192 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00193 
00194 /*! Defines the direction of a probe set or group */
00195 enum DirectionType
00196 {
00197     /*! No direction specified */
00198     NoDirection,
00199 
00200     /*! Sense
00201      * All probes in the probe set (or probe group) have the sense direction
00202      */
00203     SenseDirection,
00204 
00205     /*! Anti sense
00206      * All probes in the probe set (or probe group) have the antisense direction
00207      */
00208     AntiSenseDirection,
00209 
00210     /* !Either
00211      * Some probes in the probe set (or probe group) have antisense direction,
00212      * others have sense direction
00213      */
00214     EitherDirection
00215 };
00216 
00217 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00218 
00219 /*! Defines the type of probe replication of a group   */
00220 enum ReplicationType
00221 {
00222     /*! Unspecified replication type */
00223     UnknownRepType,
00224 
00225     /*! Different
00226      * All probes in the probe group have different sequences
00227      */
00228     DifferentRepType,
00229 
00230     /*! Mixed
00231      * Some probes in the probe group have identical sequences
00232      */
00233     MixedRepType,
00234 
00235     /* Identical
00236      * All probes in the probe group have identical sequences
00237      */
00238     IdenticalRepType
00239 };

00243 /*! This class provides storage for an individual probe in a CDF file */
00244 class CCDFProbeInformation
00245 {
00246 protected:
00247     /*! The index of the probes probe pair or quartet (probe list). Also known as the atom position. */
00248     int m_ListIndex;
00249 
00250     /*! The expos value in the CDF file, this can either be a zero based index equal to the
00251      * list index or the exon position. */
00252     int m_Expos;
00253 
00254     /*! The X coordinate */
00255     unsigned short m_X;
00256 
00257     /*! The Y coordinate */
00258     unsigned short m_Y;
00259 
00260     /*! The probes base at the interrogation position */
00261     char m_PBase;
00262 
00263     /*! The targets base at the interrogation position */
00264     char m_TBase;
00265 
00266     /*! The probe length */
00267     unsigned short m_ProbeLength;
00268 
00269     /*! The probe grouping */
00270     unsigned short m_ProbeGrouping;
00271 
00272     /*! Friend to the parent */
00273     friend class CCDFProbeGroupInformation;
00274 
00275     /*! Friend to the probe set */
00276     friend class CCDFProbeSetInformation;
00277 
00278     /*! Friend to the top level class */
00279     friend class CCDFFileData;
00280 
00281 public:
00282     /*! Returns the list index.
00283      * @return The list index.
00284      * This is an internal index used by Affymetrix chip design.
00285      */
00286     int GetListIndex() const { return m_ListIndex; }
00287 
00288     /*! Returns the expos value.
00289      * @return The expos value.
00290      * This is the position of the probe sequence in a longer sequence.  (Note
00291      * in some arrays this value may instead correspond to the GetListIndex value).
00292      * In expression arrays the longer sequence can be the sequence from which
00293      * the probe is selected.  In genotyping arrays the longer sequence can be
00294      * the sequence containing a polymorphic SNP.  More than one probe can have
00295      * the same expos value, e.g., in arrays containing perfect match/mismatch
00296      * pairs, both probes in the pair will have the same expos value.
00297      */
00298     int GetExpos() const { return m_Expos; }
00299 
00300     /*! Returns the X coordinate of the probe in the physical array.
00301      * @return The X coordinate.
00302      */
00303     int GetX() const { return m_X; }
00304 
00305     /*! Returns the Y coordinate of the probe in the physical array.
00306      * @return The Y coordinate.
00307      */
00308     int GetY() const { return m_Y; }
00309 
00310     /*! Returns the probes base at the interrogation position.
00311      * @return The probes base at the interrogation position.
00312      */
00313     char GetPBase() const { return m_PBase; }
00314 
00315     /*! Returns the targets base at the interrogation position.
00316      * @return The targets base at the interrogation position.
00317      */
00318     char GetTBase() const { return m_TBase; }
00319 
00320     /*! Returns the length of the probe.
00321      * @return The probe length.
00322      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00323      */
00324     unsigned short GetProbeLength() const { return m_ProbeLength; }
00325 
00326     /*! Returns the grouping of the probe in the physical array.
00327      * @return The probe grouping.
00328      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00329      */
00330     unsigned short GetProbeGrouping() const { return m_ProbeGrouping; }
00331 
00332     /*! Constructor */
00333     CCDFProbeInformation();
00334 };
00335 
00336 /*! The size of the probe object as stored in the XDA CDF file version 1. */
00337 #define PROBE_SIZE (4+4+2+2+1+1)
00338 
00339 /*! The size of the probe object as stored in the XDA CDF file version 2, 3 and 4. */
00340 #define PROBE_SIZE_V2 (4+4+2+2+1+1+2+2)

00344 /*! This class provides storage for a group of probes, also known as a block. */
00345 class CCDFProbeGroupInformation
00346 {
00347 protected:
00348     /*! The number of probe pairs or probe quartets in the group. */
00349     int m_NumLists;
00350 
00351     /*! The number of probes in the group. */
00352     int m_NumCells;
00353 
00354     /*! The first probes list index value. */
00355     int m_Start;
00356 
00357     /*! The last probes list index value. */
00358     int m_Stop;
00359 
00360     /*! The probe set index associated with the group. */
00361     int m_ProbeSetIndex;
00362 
00363     /*! The group index. */
00364     int m_GroupIndex;
00365 
00366     /*! The name of the group. */
00367     std::string m_Name;
00368 
00369     /*! The wobble situation. */
00370     unsigned short m_WobbleSituation;
00371 
00372     /*! The allele code. */
00373     unsigned short m_AlleleCode;
00374 
00375     /*! The channel. */
00376     unsigned char m_Channel;
00377 
00378     /*! The probe replication type. */
00379     unsigned char m_RepType;
00380 
00381     /*! The number of cells per list (1 or 2 for expression and genotyping, 4 for resequencing). */
00382     unsigned char m_NumCellsPerList;
00383 
00384     /*! The direction of the target that the probes are interrogating. */
00385     unsigned char m_Direction;
00386 
00387     /*! The probes in the group */
00388     std::vector<CCDFProbeInformation> m_Cells;
00389 
00390     /*! A pointer to the probes. This is used when memory mapping is used. */
00391     std::vector<CCDFProbeInformation> *m_pCells;
00392 
00393     /*! Friend to the parent class. */
00394     friend class CCDFProbeSetInformation;
00395 
00396     /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00397     friend class CCDFFileData;
00398 
00399     /*! Copies the data in the input object to the member variables.
00400      * @param orig The group to copy.
00401      */
00402     void MakeShallowCopy(CCDFProbeGroupInformation &orig);
00403 
00404 public:
00405     /*! Gets the groups direction.
00406      * @return The groups direction.
00407      * See the DirectionType enumeration for details
00408      */
00409     DirectionType GetDirection() const { return (DirectionType)m_Direction; }
00410 
00411     /*! Gets the number of lists (atoms) in the group.
00412      * @return The number of lists (atoms) in the group.
00413      * In expression and genotyping arrays probes may be arranged in singletons or paired
00414      * with a mismatch probe. In resequencing arrays probes may be arranged in quartes.
00415      * Note that multiple arrangements may be present on the same
00416      * array, but not within a probe group (or probe set).
00417      * Each such singleton or pair or quartet is a "list" or "atom."
00418      */
00419     int GetNumLists() const { return m_NumLists; }
00420 
00421     /*! Gets the number of probes in the group.
00422      * @return The number of probes in the group.
00423      */
00424     int GetNumCells() const { return m_NumCells; }
00425 
00426     /*! Gets the number of probes per list.
00427      * @return The number of probes per list.
00428      * Always constant within a probe group or probe set.
00429      */
00430     int GetNumCellsPerList() const { return (int)m_NumCellsPerList; }
00431 
00432     /*! Gets the start list index value.
00433      * @return The start list index value.
00434      * This is the minimum value returned by GetListIndex()
00435      * This is an internal index used by Affymetrix chip design.
00436      */
00437     int GetStart() const { return m_Start; }
00438 
00439     /*! Gets the stop list index value.
00440      * @return The stop list index value.
00441      * This is the maximum value returned by GetListIndex()
00442      * This is an internal index used by Affymetrix chip design.
00443      */
00444     int GetStop() const { return m_Stop; }
00445 
00446     /*! Gets the group name.
00447      * @return The group name.
00448      */
00449     std::string GetName() { return m_Name; }
00450 
00451     /*! Gets the wobble situation.
00452      * @return The wobble situation.
00453      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00454      */
00455     unsigned short GetWobbleSituation() const { return m_WobbleSituation; }
00456 
00457     /*! Gets the allele code.
00458      * @return The allele code.
00459      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00460      */
00461     unsigned short GetAlleleCode() const { return m_AlleleCode; }
00462 
00463     /*! Gets the channel.
00464      * @return The channel.
00465      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1 and 2.
00466      */
00467     unsigned char GetChannel() const { return m_Channel; }
00468 
00469     /*! Gets the probe replication type.
00470      * @return The probe replication type.
00471      * See the ReplicationType enumeration for details
00472      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1 and 2.
00473      */
00474     ReplicationType GetRepType() const { return (ReplicationType) m_RepType; }
00475 
00476     /*! Retrieves the probe object given a zero-based index.
00477      * @param cell_index zero-based index in the probe group to the probe of interest.
00478      * @param info The returned probe data.
00479      * Note: this has nothing to do with list index returned by GetListIndex
00480      */
00481     void GetCell(int cell_index, CCDFProbeInformation & info);
00482 
00483     /*! Constructor */
00484     CCDFProbeGroupInformation();
00485 
00486     /*! Destructor */
00487     ~CCDFProbeGroupInformation();
00488 };
00489 
00490 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file version 1. */
00491 #define PROBE_GROUP_SIZE (MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH+4+4+4+4+1+1)
00492 
00493 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file version 2. */
00494 #define PROBE_GROUP_SIZE_V2 (MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH+4+4+4+4+1+1+2+2)
00495 
00496 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file version 3 and 4. */
00497 #define PROBE_GROUP_SIZE_V3 (MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH+4+4+4+4+1+1+2+2+1+1)

00501 /*! This class provides storage for a probe set. */
00502 class CCDFProbeSetInformation
00503 {
00504 protected:
00505     /*! The number of lists (atoms) in the probe set. */
00506     int m_NumLists;
00507 
00508     /*! The number of groups (blocks) in the probe set. */
00509     int m_NumGroups;
00510 
00511     /*! The number of probes in the set. */
00512     int m_NumCells;
00513 
00514     /*! An index for the probe set.*/
00515     int m_Index;
00516 
00517     /*! An arbitrary number assigned to the probe set. */
00518     int m_ProbeSetNumber;
00519 
00520     /*! The type of probe set. */
00521     unsigned short m_ProbeSetType;
00522 
00523     /*! The direction of the target that the probes are interrogating. */
00524     unsigned char m_Direction;
00525 
00526     /*! The number of probes per list. */
00527     unsigned char m_NumCellsPerList;
00528 
00529     /*! The groups in the set. */
00530     std::vector<CCDFProbeGroupInformation> m_Groups;
00531 
00532     /*! A pointer to the groups. This is used when memory mapping is used. */
00533     std::vector<CCDFProbeGroupInformation> *m_pGroups;
00534 
00535     /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00536     friend class CCDFFileData;
00537 
00538     /*! Copies the data in the input object to the member variables.
00539      * @param orig The probe set to copy.
00540      */
00541     void MakeShallowCopy(CCDFProbeSetInformation &orig);
00542 
00543 public:
00544     /*! Gets the probe set type.
00545      * @return The probe set type.
00546      * see GeneChipProbeSetType for details
00547      */
00548     GeneChipProbeSetType GetProbeSetType() const { return (GeneChipProbeSetType)m_ProbeSetType; }
00549 
00550     /*! Gets the probe sets direction.
00551      * @return The probe sets direction.
00552      * See the DirectionType enumeration for details
00553      */
00554     DirectionType GetDirection() const { return (DirectionType)m_Direction; }
00555 
00556     /*! Gets the number of lists (atoms) in the set.
00557      * @return The number of lists (atoms) in the set.
00558      * See GetNumLists for probe group for details
00559      */
00560     int GetNumLists() const { return m_NumLists; }
00561 
00562     /*! The number of groups in the set.
00563      * @return The number of groups in the set.
00564      * In genotyping arrays it is convenient to group organize probes that interrogate
00565      * a polymorphic SNP into subsets that interrogate a particular allele and have
00566      * the same direction (i.e., sense or antisense).  Each grouping is a "probe group."
00567      * Affymetrix also uses the term "block" for a "probe group."
00568      */
00569     int GetNumGroups() const { return m_NumGroups; }
00570 
00571     /*! The number of probes in the set.
00572      * @return The number of probes in the set.
00573      */
00574     int GetNumCells() const { return m_NumCells; }
00575 
00576     /*! Gets the number of probes per list.
00577      * @return The number of probes per list.
00578      * Always constant within a probe group or probe set.
00579      */
00580     int GetNumCellsPerList() const { return (int)m_NumCellsPerList; }
00581 
00582     /*! Gets the probe set number.
00583      * @return The probe set number.
00584      * This is an internal value used by Affymetrix chip design.
00585      */
00586     int GetProbeSetNumber() const { return m_ProbeSetNumber; }
00587 
00588     /*! Gets a group object.
00589      * @param index The index to the group of interest.
00590      * @param info The returned group data.
00591      */
00592     void GetGroupInformation(int index, CCDFProbeGroupInformation & info);
00593 
00594     /*! Constructor */
00595     CCDFProbeSetInformation();
00596 
00597     /*! Destructor */
00598     ~CCDFProbeSetInformation();
00599 };

00606 /*! This class provides storage for the list of probe set names. */
00607 class CCDFProbeSetNames
00608 {
00609 public:
00610     /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00611     friend class CCDFFileData;
00612 
00613     /*! Constructor */
00614     CCDFProbeSetNames();
00615 
00616     /*! Destructor */
00617     ~CCDFProbeSetNames();
00618 
00619     /*! Deallocates memory used by the class. */
00620     void Clear();
00621 
00622 protected:
00623 
00624     /*! Array of probe set names, used if not memory mapping. */
00625     std::vector<std::string> m_ProbeSetNames;
00626 
00627     /*! Resizes the probe set name array. */
00628     void Resize(int size);
00629 
00630     /*! Stores the name of the probe set in the internal array. */
00631     void SetName(int index, std::string name);
00632 
00633 public:
00634     /*! Gets the probe set name.
00635      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set name of interest.
00636      * @return The name of the probe set.
00637      */
00638     std::string GetName(int index) const;
00639 };

00641 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00642 
00643 /*! This class provides storage for QC probes */
00644 class CCDFQCProbeInformation
00645 {
00646 public:
00647     /*! Constructor */
00648     CCDFQCProbeInformation();
00649 
00650 protected:
00651     /*! The X coordinate of the probe */
00652     unsigned short m_X;
00653 
00654     /*! The Y coordinate of the probe */
00655     unsigned short m_Y;
00656 
00657     /*! The probe length. This value may be 1 for non-synthesized features */
00658     unsigned char m_PLen;
00659 
00660     /*! Flag indicating if the probe is a perfect match probe. */
00661     unsigned char m_PMProbe;
00662 
00663     /*! Flag indicating if the probe is used for background calculations (blank feature). */
00664     unsigned char m_Background;
00665 
00666     /*! Friend to the parent class */
00667     friend class CCDFQCProbeSetInformation;
00668 
00669     /*! Friend to the top level CDF class */
00670     friend class CCDFFileData;
00671 
00672 public:
00673     /*! Gets the X coordinate of the probe.
00674      * @return The X coordinate.
00675      */
00676     int GetX() const { return m_X; }
00677 
00678     /*! Gets the Y cooridnate of the probe.
00679      * @return The Y coordinate.
00680      */
00681     int GetY() const { return m_Y; }
00682 
00683     /*! Gets the probe length.
00684      * @return The probe length. This value may be 1 for non-synthesized features.
00685      */
00686     int GetPLen() const { return m_PLen; }
00687 
00688     /*! Gets the flag indicating if the probe is a perfect match probe.
00689      * @return The flag indicating if the probe is a perfect match probe
00690      */
00691     bool IsPerfectMatchProbe() const { return (m_PMProbe == 1 ? true : false); }
00692 
00693     /*! Gets a flag indicating if the probe is used for background calculations (blank feature).
00694      * @return Flag indicating if the probe is used for background calculations (blank feature).
00695      */
00696     bool IsBackgroundProbe() const { return (m_Background == 1 ? true : false); }
00697 };
00698 
00699 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file. */
00700 #define QC_PROBE_SIZE (2+2+1+1+1)
00701 
00702 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00703 
00704 /*! The type of QC probe set */
00705 enum GeneChipQCProbeSetType
00706 {
00707     /*! Unknown probe set */
00708     UnknownQCProbeSetType,
00709 
00710     /*! Probes used for the checker board patterns for antisense arrays. */
00711     CheckerboardNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00712

00729     CentralNegativeQCProbeSetType,

00732     CentralPositiveQCProbeSetType,

00738     GeneExpPositiveQCProbeSetType,

00767 /*! This class provides storage for the probes in a QC probe set. */
00768 class CCDFQCProbeSetInformation
00769 {
00770 protected:
00771     /*! The number of probes in the set. */
00772     int m_NumCells;
00773 
00774     /*! The type of QC probes. */
00775     unsigned short m_QCProbeSetType;
00776 
00777     /*! The array of probes. */
00778     std::vector<CCDFQCProbeInformation> m_Cells;
00779 
00780     /*! The array of probes. */
00781     std::vector<CCDFQCProbeInformation> *m_pCells;
00782 
00783     /*! Friend to the top level CDF class. */
00784     friend class CCDFFileData;
00785 
00786     /*! Copies the data in the input object to the member variables.
00787      * @param orig The probe set to copy.
00788      */
00789     void MakeShallowCopy(CCDFQCProbeSetInformation &orig);
00790 
00791 public:
00792     /*! Gets the probe set type.
00793      * @return The probe set type.
00794      */
00795     GeneChipQCProbeSetType GetQCProbeSetType() const { return (GeneChipQCProbeSetType)m_QCProbeSetType; }
00796 
00797     /*! Gets the number of probes in the set.
00798      * @return The number of probes in the set.
00799      */
00800     int GetNumCells() const { return m_NumCells; }
00801 
00802     /*! Gets the information about a single probe in the set.
00803      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe of interest.
00804      * @param info The information about the probe.
00805      */
00806     void GetProbeInformation(int index, CCDFQCProbeInformation & info);
00807 
00808     /*! Constructor */
00809     CCDFQCProbeSetInformation();
00810 
00811     /*! Destructor */
00812     ~CCDFQCProbeSetInformation();
00813 };

00815 /*! This is the size of the QC probe set object in a binary CDF file. */
00816 #define QC_PROBE_SET_SIZE (4+2)

00819 
00820 /*! This class provides storage and reading capabilities for a CDF file. */
00821 class CCDFFileData
00822 {
00823 protected:
00824     /*! The position of the probe set names in the XDA file. */
00825     std::ios::pos_type probeSetNamePos;
00826 
00827     /*! The position of the QC probe set index array in the XDA file. */
00828     std::ios::pos_type qcSetIndexPos;
00829 
00830     /*! The position of the probe set index array in the XDA file. */
00831     std::ios::pos_type probeSetIndexPos;
00832 
00833     /*! What was the last probesetindex read?
00834      *  This state allows us to handle sequential reads quickly. (no seeking.)
00835      */
00836     uint32_t m_probeSetIndex_last;
00837 
00838     /*! 1 if like m_probeSetIndex_last is valid.
00839      *  The seekg method clears this.
00840      */
00841     uint32_t m_probeSetIndex_last_valid;
00842 
00843     /*! Use this seekg method when seeking with the iteratorReader.
00844      *  It updates the state needed for sequenial reads.
00845      */
00846     void seekg(uint32_t pos, const std::ios_base::seekdir& dir)
00847     {
00848         // invalidate the last probe state
00849         m_probeSetIndex_last_valid=0;
00850         // m_probeSetIndex_last=0; // we dont need to clear this as we just cleared "_valid"
00851         // and do the seek
00852         iteratorReader.seekg(pos,dir);
00853     }
00854 
00855     /*! The file stream for the probe set information iterator. */
00856     std::ifstream iteratorReader;
00857 
00858     /*! Flag to indicate that only the header part of the file is to be read. */
00859     bool readHeaderOnly;
00860 
00861     /*! The file header object. */
00862     CCDFFileHeader m_Header;
00863 
00864     /*! The list of probe set names. */
00865     CCDFProbeSetNames m_ProbeSetNames;
00866 
00867     /*! An array of probe sets. */
00868     std::vector<CCDFProbeSetInformation> m_ProbeSets;
00869 
00870     /*! An array of QC probe sets. */
00871     std::vector<CCDFQCProbeSetInformation> m_QCProbeSets;
00872 
00873     /*! The CDF file name (full path). */
00874     std::string m_FileName;
00875 
00876     /*! A string to hold an error message upon read failures. */
00877     std::string m_strError;
00878 
00879     /*! Opens the file for reading.
00880      * @return True if successful.
00881      */
00882     bool Open();
00883 
00884     /*! Reads a text format CDF file.
00885      * @return True if successful.
00886      */
00887     bool ReadTextFormat();
00888 
00889     /*! Reads an XDA format CDF file.
00890      * @return True if successful.
00891      */
00892     bool ReadXDAFormat();
00893 
00894     /*! Reads the header of an XDA format CDF file.
00895      * @return True if successful.
00896      */
00897     bool ReadXDAHeader();
00898 
00899 public:
00900     /*! Sets the name of the file.
00901      * @param name The full path of the CDF file.
00902      */
00903     void SetFileName(const char *name) { m_FileName = name; }
00904 
00905     /*! Gets the name of the file.
00906      * @return The full path of the CDF file.
00907      */
00908     std::string GetFileName() const { return m_FileName; }
00909 
00910     /*! Gets the header object.
00911      * @return The CDF file header object.
00912      */
00913     CCDFFileHeader &GetHeader() { return m_Header; }
00914 
00915         /*! Get GUID
00916          * @return GUID
00917          */
00918         std::string GetGUID();
00919 
00920         /*! Get integrity md5
00921          * @return The integrity md5
00922          */
00923         std::string GetIntegrityMd5();
00924 
00925         /*! Gets the error string.
00926      * @return A string describing the last read error.
00927      */
00928     std::string GetError() const { return m_strError; }
00929 
00930     /*! Gets the name of a probe set.
00931      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set name of interest.
00932      * @return The probe set name.
00933      */
00934     std::string GetProbeSetName(int index);
00935 
00936     /*! Gets the chip type (probe array type) of the CDF file.
00937      * @return The chip type. This is just the name (without extension) of the CDF file.
00938      */
00939     std::string GetChipType();
00940 
00941     /*! Gets the chip types (probe array type) of the CDF file. Allow substrings deliminated by '.'
00942      * @return vector of chip types
00943      */
00944     std::vector<std::string> GetChipTypes();
00945 
00946     /*! Reads the entire file.
00947      * @return True if successful.
00948      */
00949     bool Read();
00950 
00951     /*! Reads the header of the file only.
00952      * @return True if successful.
00953      */
00954     bool ReadHeader();
00955 
00956     /*! Checks if the file exists.
00957      * @return True if the file exists.
00958      */
00959     bool Exists();
00960 
00961     /*! Deallocates memory and closes any file handles. */
00962     void Close();
00963 
00964     /*! Determines if a CDF file is of the XDA (binary) format.
00965      * @return True if XDA format.
00966      */
00967     bool IsXDACompatibleFile();
00968 
00969     /*! Gets the probe set type for non-qc probe sets.
00970      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set of interest.
00971      * @return The type of probe set.
00972      */
00973     GeneChipProbeSetType GetProbeSetType(int index);
00974 
00975     /*! Gets the probe set information.
00976      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set of interest.
00977      * @param info The probe set information.
00978      * @return The probe set information.
00979      */
00980     void GetProbeSetInformation(int index, CCDFProbeSetInformation & info);
00981 
00982     /*! Gets the QC probe set information by index.
00983      * @param index The zero-based index to the QC probe set of interest.
00984      * @param info The QC probe set information.
00985      * @return The QC probe set information.
00986      */
00987     void GetQCProbeSetInformation(int index, CCDFQCProbeSetInformation & info);
00988 
00989     /*! Gets the QC probe set information by type.
00990      * @param qcType The type of QC probe set to retrieve.
00991      * @param info The QC probe set information.
00992      * @return The QC probe set information.
00993      */
00994     void GetQCProbeSetInformation(GeneChipQCProbeSetType qcType, CCDFQCProbeSetInformation & info);
00995 
00996     /*! Constructor */
00997     CCDFFileData();
00998 
00999     /*! Destructor */
01000     ~CCDFFileData();
01001 };
